question: What is the maximum home loan I can afford with an annual income of $80,000 and monthly debts of $500?
true_answer: With an income of $80,000 and monthly debts of $500, you can afford a home loan of approximately $320,000. This assumes a 30-year fixed mortgage with a 3% interest rate.

steps.content: What is the maximum home loan I can afford with an annual income of $80,000 and monthly debts of $500?
Plan: 1) Send to home_loan_agent to assess affordability. 2) Calculate DTI. 3) Use credit_agent for credit assessment. 4) Calculate maximum loan using calculator. 5) Supervisor final review.
Retrieving guidelines for home loan affordability.
Generally, affordability considers income, debts, and credit score, aiming for DTI below 43%.
Calculating debt-to-income ratio with income of $80,000 and monthly debts of $500.
Calculated DTI is 25%, which is manageable for a home loan.
Checking credit requirements for loan affordability.
A credit score of 700 or more generally improves loan terms.
Using a 30-year fixed mortgage rate of 3%, calculating maximum loan amount.
Maximum loan amount calculated is approximately $320,000.
How does my credit score impact this calculation?
Retrieving information on impact of credit score on loan terms.
Credit score affects interest rates and loan approval; higher scores typically mean better rates.
With an income of $80,000 and monthly debts of $500, you can afford a home loan of approximately $320,000. This assumes a 30-year fixed mortgage with a 3% interest rate.
